communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Flock Sentinel - Spokane
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

List and map of privately-owned devices, such as cameras and automatic license plate readers, integrated with the Sheriff's Office's Flock system, such as those participating in the Spokane County Sentinel program: https://refer.flocksafety.com/spokane-sentinel/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Sheriff Public Records Request :: S019217-070424
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse: 
Thank you for your interest in public records of Spokane County. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with the State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. Your request was received in this office on 7/4/2024 and given the reference number S019217-070424 for tracking purposes. Records Requested: To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

List and map of privately-owned devices, such as cameras and automatic license plate readers, integrated with the Sheriff's Office's Flock system, such as those participating in the Spokane County Sentinel program: https://refer.flocksafety.com/spokane-sentinel/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fspokane-county-sheriffs-office-561%252Fflock-sentinel-spokane-168091%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAwLMyQ_gKHxZfHlysTK9ujJ1s%3A1sPY64%3Av2RGCARJakw4VJXvipJXIkvR9ataCveWqeXAV1AFqZc 
Not all public documents are available in electronic format. If the document(s) requested are not available electronically, we will make them available for inspection or by paper copy in accordance with the Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW. 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. PLEASE NOTE: The State of Washington Public Records Act, Chapter 42.56 RCW, does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
Please be advised that Spokane Regional Emergency Communications ("SREC") is the custodian of 911 and Crime Check audio recordings as well as audio recordings of dispatch and radio traffic. If you are attempting to obtain audio recordings of 911/Crime Check calls and/or radio traffic, you need to submit a separate request to SREC directly. You can submit a records request to SREC via their website, https://www.srec911.com. 
Spokane County

communications.subject: [Records Center] Sheriff Public Records Request :: S019217-070424
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Rose Terse: 
In accordance with the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.520, this message acknowledges receipt of your public records request, received by Spokane County on 7/4/2024. This request has been assigned reference codeS019217-070424. Please include this code in any communications concerning this request. 
Specifically, you requested: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

List and map of privately-owned devices, such as cameras and automatic license plate readers, integrated with the Sheriff's Office's Flock system, such as those participating in the Spokane County Sentinel program: https://refer.flocksafety.com/spokane-sentinel/ 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fspokane-county-sheriffs-office-561%252Fflock-sentinel-spokane-168091%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAwLMyQ_gKHxZfHlysTK9ujJ1s%3A1sPY64%3Av2RGCARJakw4VJXvipJXIkvR9ataCveWqeXAV1AFqZc” 
Our procedure is to locate records, review them for exemptions, and then prepare them for your inspection or copying. Due to the potential volume of records that may be responsive to this request, as well as the complexity of identifying and gathering the records, we anticipate processing this request in installments. We are currently processing over 748 active requests. This does mean that it can take time to process requests, but we work to provide requestors with installments of their records on a timely basis. 
We reasonably anticipate an installment/requested records will be available on or before August 9, 2024. If public records become available in advance of this estimate, we will let you know. Conversely, if staff encounters a need to extend our estimate, we will advise accordingly. 
With respect to audio recordings, please be advised that Spokane Regional Emergency Communications ("SREC") is the custodian of 911/Crime Check audio recordings as well as audio recordings of radio traffic. If you are attempting to obtain audio recordings of 911/Crime Check calls and/or radio traffic, you need to submit a separate request to SREC directly via the following link: https://srec911.com/ 
Finally, please be advised that there may be fees associated with the copying of public records. Please take a moment to  familiarize yourself with Spokane County's Public Records Request Policy and Fee Schedule, which can be found in the FAQs section. 
Sincerely, 
JOHN F. NOWELS, Sheriff 
Spokane County 
TK 
Public Records Officer 
Please do not update subject line above when replying.

Rose Terse: 
This message is to provide an update regarding your public records request assigned reference code S019217-070424. Please include this code in any communications concerning this request. 
Specifically, you requested: “To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

List and map of privately-owned devices, such as cameras and automatic license plate readers, integrated with the Sheriff's Office's Flock system, such as those participating in the Spokane County Sentinel program: https://refer.flocksafety.com/spokane-sentinel/ 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fspokane-county-sheriffs-office-561%252Fflock-sentinel-spokane-168091%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAAwLMyQ_gKHxZfHlysTK9ujJ1s%3A1sPY64%3Av2RGCARJakw4VJXvipJXIkvR9ataCveWqeXAV1AFqZc” 
The responsive records are now available for download in the “My Request Center” of the public records portal. Instructions for downloading the files follows:  
  * Navigate to the Spokane County Public Records Center by following the blue "Public Records Center" hyperlink contained in the footer of this email. 
  * Log in with your user name and password. You will be taken directly into this request. 
  * Click on the "Download All" button directly above the blue "Files" box. *If you have a pop-up blocker, you will need to allow pop-ups for this site in order for the files to download. After they have downloaded, if the files do not open automatically, they will appear in your computer's "Downloads" folder. 
The Spokane County Sheriff's Office is obligated to provide records in accordance with the Washington State Public Records Act. Please note that the records you have requested may contain images and/or descriptions of events that are considered graphic in nature and may not be suitable for children or those who are sensitive to such material. 
This request is now considered concluded and closed because all responsive records have been provided. This is our final, definitive response to this request. Now that this request is closed, the Public Records Act's one-year statute of limitations to seek judicial review has started to run because the agency does not intend to further address this request. If you have questions or concerns about this request, please contact us within 10 business days of the date of this message. If we may be of further assistance, please advise. PLEASE NOTE: If you want to pick up printed copies of the records from the Public Safety Building, you must call 509-477-6926 at least one business day before you plan to arrive so that we can have the records ready for you. Depending on the number of pages, printing charges may apply. 
Sincerely, 
JOHN F. NOWELS, Sheriff 
Spokane County 
Tiffany Kinnick 
Public Records Officer 
Please do not update subject line above when replying.

title: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

CAD Files, bodycams,dashcams and police reports mentioning a Jimmy Jones or 2002 Ford F250 without plates for the the following time spans:

October 2020
January 2021
February 2021
March 2021
April 1st 2021

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
Hello Samuel Newton,

In response to your records request, the Pagosa Springs Police Department
does not have any written reports concerning Jimmy Jones.  The police
department did have contact with Mr. Jones on 10-06-2021, Call for Service
Report number #21-16942 and on 06-21-2022 Call for Service Report number
#22-19418.  To obtain those records please contact Archuleta County
Dispatch Center.  Any digital video associated with contact with Mr. Jones
has been destroyed per policy, Colorado Municipal Records Retention
Schedule 100.080(g).

 Please contact me if you have any questions or further information.

Thank you,
Janette





-- 







*Janette WennerlundAdministrative AssistantPagosa Springs Police

communications.communication:
Oh. Okay.
Thank you for clarifying.

I'd like to ammend my request with the following:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act (CORA), I am requesting access to and a copy of the logs of all CORA requests submitted to your agency over the past 180 days. This request includes, but is not limited to, the dates of requests, the nature of the requests, the responses provided, and any associated correspondence.

Please provide the requested records in an electronic format if possible. If there are any fees for searching, reviewing, or copying the records, please inform me before processing my request. Additionally, if you need any further information or clarification to locate these records, please let me know at your earliest convenience.

Thank you for your assistance and prompt attention to this matter.

Hi Samuel. Will you please clarify what you are seeking in terms of "responses provided?" In other words, are you seeking the Town's written responses to CORA requests received over the past 180 days or are you also seeking the underlying records? Additionally, I'd like to confirm that you want logs of all CORA requests received over the past 180, unlimited by subject, requester, etc.?

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
Written responses. 
The underlying records need not be included.

All available logs.

communications.subject: Re: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
Good morning,
Pagosa Springs Police Department retains the CORA request for two (2) years
according to the  Colorado Municipal Retention Schedule 100.080(Q).  In the
year of 2022 and 2023, a log was not generated.  The CORA request forms
completed by victims will need to be redacted with any other non
releasable information and a redaction fee of $33.58 per hour, not
including the first hour, will be charged.  If you are requesting only the
police department's response to the cora request, I can send these to you
without a fee.  Can you please clarify what information you are seeking?
1) Requestor's information?
2) Police response (granted or denied)?

Thank you for your patience,
Janette


--

For Reference:

https://casetext.com/case/jones-v-reis-1

files.title: Screenshot_20240731-173715.png
files.source: Samuel Newton

communications.communication:
Good Morning Samuel, 

The Pagosa Springs Police Department does not have any documents related to any court actions related to Jimmy Jones, nor has it received related correspondence from the Attorney General's Office or complaints. 

Will you please clarify your question/specify a timeline regarding Writs of Mandamus? Whether the Department has "ever" received these documents is an overly broad request. 

In general and to the extent possible, please compile any additional questions into one request with sufficient specificity and time ranges. While the Department wants to effectively respond to your request, it must keep in mind the limited resources/staffing it has to do so.

communications.subject: RE: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Jimmy Jones CAD Files (Pagosa Springs Police Department)
communications.communication:
I'd like to search the past 180 days and if nothing comes up search the past 360 days. 

Thank you for you assistance.

Hi Samuel, 

The Town has not received any Writs of Mandamus in regard to any FOI, CORA, CJRA request in the past 360 days.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Contract, FinalSite
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Records sufficient to show the contract for ACTIVE INTERNET TECHNOLOGIES, LLC DBA FINALSITE as authorized by Board Report 23-0322-PR8.
2. All invoices produced by Active Internet Technologies, LLC dba FinalSite during this contract term, to date.
3. All payments CPS has made to Active Internet Technologies, LLC dba FinalSite during this contract term, to date.

The contract is not publicly listed on the procurement database as required.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

Chicago Public Schools (CPS) responds to all public records requests in accordance with the Illinois Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 ILCS 140/1 et seq. 
Due to the volume and complexity of requests received in the normal course of business, CPS is extending the time for its initial response to your request by an additional 5 business days (to 10 business days total beginning on the first business day following receipt of the request) pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/3(e)(v) which allows for the examination and evaluation of the requested records by personnel to determine if they are exempt from disclosure under Section 7 of Illinois FOIA or should be revealed only with appropriate deletions. 
Upon the completion of a response, CPS will provide the first 50 pages to you at no charge.  If a response is more than 50 pages, a fee of 15¢ per page will be charged for each additional page. Copies of video recordings have a fee of $48. All applicable fees must be paid prior to the copying. CPS will inform you of any fees due if your paper response exceeds 50 pages. You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you’ll receive an email when your request has been completed. Thank you for using the CPS FOIA Center. 

Track the issue status and respond at: https://cps.mycusthelp.com/WEBAPP//_rs/RequestEdit.aspx?rid=15889

To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

1. Records sufficient to show the contract for ACTIVE INTERNET TECHNOLOGIES, LLC DBA FINALSITE as authorized by Board Report 23-0322-PR8. 
2. All invoices produced by Active Internet Technologies, LLC dba FinalSite during this contract term, to date. 
3. All payments CPS has made to Active Internet Technologies, LLC dba FinalSite during this contract term, to date. 

The contract is not publicly listed on the procurement database as required. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fcontract-finalsite-170019%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ6_n4zL9LUQrOAhSu0BQ7O8%3A1sWRLX%3AtWZj_uuX-MEdZ3ykk0eqyjAjhWBTUawc1xZy3tytn_4 RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Redactions were made pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(kk) which exempts the public body's credit card numbers, debit card numbers, bank account numbers, Federal Employer Identification Number, security code numbers, passwords, and similar account information, the disclosure of which could result in identity theft or impression or defrauding of a governmental entity or a person. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Littleton Branch Appointment Logs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to and a copy of the logs of scheduled appointments for the Arapahoe County DMV - Littleton Branch (5334 S. Prince St., Littleton, CO 80120). Specifically, I am interested in the June 2024 logs detailing:

 1. Date and time of each scheduled appointment.
 2. The purpose of each appointment (e.g., driver's license renewal, vehicle registration).
 3. The anonymized identifier for each appointment (to protect personal privacy while providing insight into the volume and types of appointments scheduled).
 4. Whether or not each appointment was attended.
 5. Whether the appointment was booked online or in person with a kiosk.
 6. The duration of each appointment from check-in to completion.
 7. The wait time, if any, between the scheduled appointment time and the actual start of the appointment.
 8. The reason for any missed appointments (if available).
 9. Customer feedback or satisfaction ratings associated with each appointment (if collected).

If these records are maintained in an electronic format, I would prefer to receive them in a machine-readable format such as CSV or Excel. If there are any fees for searching, reviewing, or duplicating the records, please inform me if the cost exceeds $20.00.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Samuel Newton

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Layla the Mighty Minter
communications.communication:
Dear U.S. Mint:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act. I am requesting records related to the U.S. Mint's mascot, Layla the Mighty Minter.

RECORDS REQUESTED:

(A) All records related to the conception of and process of designing the Layla mascot (emails and other correspondence, memoranda, contracts, sketches, etc.)

(B) Records sufficient to answer the following questions:

(1) Whose idea was it to create an U.S. Mint mascot in the first place, and why?

(2) Who designed the Layla mascot, and what was the design process like? (e.g. were there multiple design concepts submitted? Was the design of the character contracted out? (If so, kindly produce the contract).

(3) Were any Layla-related promotional items or tchotchkes created (e.g. trading cards, CDs, coloring books)? If so, please produce them.

(4) Were there any life-size Layla costumes created? If so, please produce records related to the design of the costume (contracts, sketches, etc.) and any guidelines regarding the use of or care for the costume.

(5) Did anyone in Congress ever object to the U.S. Mint's use of a mascot? I understand that there have been periodic attempts by lawmakers (e.g. former Oklahoma senator Tom Coburn, current Iowa senator Jodi Ernst) to rein in agency spending on mascots. If so, please produce all records related to that.

(6) What has the public's reaction been to the Layla mascot?

(7) Is the Mint still using Layla as part of its public outreach? If not, why not?

REQUEST FOR FEE WAIVER:

The requested documents will be made available to the general public online for free, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. I am working on a project examining the history, creation, evolution, and use of mascots across the federal government—because, like many others, I find them fascinating and weirdly delightful. Thus, I respectfully request that any fees related to this request be waived. If you do decide to charge me fees, please notify me in advance if you expect those fees to exceed $25.

FORM OF PRODUCTION:

I would prefer that this request be filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

CONCLUSION:

Thank you very much for your cooperation with this request. I look forward to hearing from you soon!

Sincerely,

Nicholas Marritz

Thank you for contacting the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS). This is an auto reply message.

As the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) ombudsman, OGIS assists FOIA requesters and federal agencies by helping them resolve their FOIA disputes, and by addressing their questions and concerns about the FOIA process. Please note, we are experiencing an increase in our inquiries received and are working to respond as soon as possible. We apologize for any delays in our response and assure you that all emails are tracked. We look forward to assisting you.

If you seek OGIS’s assistance with a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) dispute and have not done so already, please email us:
- A brief description of your dispute
- A copy of your FOIA request
- The agency’s response to your request
- Your appeal letter (if you filed an appeal)
- The agency's response to your appeal (if you received a response)  

We encourage you to transmit documents as PDF attachments via email, rather than through postal mail, which may cause delays in our response.

Sincerely,
The OGIS Staff

title: Misconduct Allegations New Orleans ICE Field Office

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Misconduct Allegations New Orleans ICE Field Office
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All complaints of alleged misconduct by ICE employees working in the New Orleans ICE Field Office received since the beginning of Fiscal Year 2020.
2. All records concerning the investigation or resolution of those complaints.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Al Otro Lado

communications.subject: ICE FOIA Request 2022-ICFO-15653
communications.communication:
May 11, 2022 Al Otro Lado MuckRock News DEPT MR 127385 411A Highland Ave Somerville, MA 02144-2516 RE:     ICE FOIA Case Number 2022-ICFO-15653  Dear Mr. Otro Lado: This acknowledges receipt of your April 12, 2022, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE), for all complaints of alleged misconduct by ICE employees working in the New Orleans ICE Field Office received since the beginning of Fiscal Year 2020 and all records concerning the investigation or resolution of those complaints.  Your request was received in this office on May 11, 2022. PLEASENOTE: Requesters seekingresponsive records from the U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE) areencouraged to create a DHS FOIA Public Access Link (PAL) accountat: . Creating a PALaccount will allow you to directly submit your FOIA request to ICE and trackthe status of your request. In PAL, you can view your prior PAL submissions,sent correspondences, and responsive records. Although PAL is preferred, ICEFOIA will continue to accept FOIA requests via email at (https://foiarequest.dhs.gov/) https://foiarequest.dhs.gov or via regularmail at U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement, Freedom ofInformation Act Office, 500 12 ICE-FOIA@ice.dhs.gov th St. SW, STOP 5009, Washington,DC 20536-5009. Due to the increasing number of FOIA requests received by this office, we may encounter some delay in processing your request. Per Section 5.5(a) of the DHS FOIA regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, ICE processes FOIA requests according to their order of receipt. Although ICE’s goal is to respond within 20 business days of receipt of your request, the FOIA does permit a 10-day extension of this time period. As your request seeks numerous documents that will necessitate a thorough and wide-ranging search, ICE will invoke a 10-day extension for your request, as allowed by Title 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(B). If you care to narrow the scope of your request, please contact our office. We will make every effort to comply with your request in a timely manner. Provisions of the FOIA allow us to recover part of the cost of complying with your request.  We shall charge you for records in accordance with the DHS Interim FOIA regulations as they apply to non-commercial requesters.  As a non-commercial requester, you will be charged 10 cents per page for duplication; the first 100 pages are free, as are the first two hours of search time, after which you will pay the per quarter-hour rate ($4.00 for clerical personnel, $7.00 for professional personnel, $10.25 for managerial personnel) of the searcher.  We will construe the submission of your request as an agreement to pay up to $25.00. You will be contacted before any further fees are accrued. We have queried the appropriate program offices within ICE for responsive records. If any responsive records are located, they will be reviewed for determination of releasability. Please be assured that one of the processors in our office will respond to your request as expeditiously as possible. We appreciate your patience as we proceed with your request. 
Your request has been assigned reference number 2022-ICFO-15653. Please refer to this identifier in any future correspondence. To check the status of an ICE FOIA/PA request, please visit . Please note that to check the status of a request, you must enter the 2022-ICFO-15653 tracking number. If you need any further assistance or would like to discuss any aspect of your request, please contact the FOIA office. You may send an e-mail to ice-foia@ice.dhs.gov, call toll free (866) 633-1182, or you may contact our FOIA Public Liaison, Marcus Francis, in the same manner. Additionally, you have a right to right to seek dispute resolution services from the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) which mediates disputes between FOIA requesters and Federal agencies as a non-exclusive alternative to litigation. If you are requesting access to your own records (which is considered a Privacy Act request), you should know that OGIS does not have the authority to handle requests made under the Privacy Act of 1974. You may contact OGIS as follows: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, Maryland 20740-6001, e-mail at ogis@nara.gov; telephone at 202-741-5770; toll free at 1-877-684-6448; or facsimile at 202-741-5769. (http://www.dhs.gov/foia-status) http://www.dhs.gov/foia-status
Regards, 

ICE FOIA Office 
Immigration and Customs Enforcement 
Freedom of Information Act Office 
500 12th Street, S.W., Stop 5009 
Washington, D.C. 20536-5009 
Telephone: 1-866-633-1182 
Visit our FOIA website at www.ice.gov/foia

title: MO Civil Rights Cases/Conspiracy Against Rights/Deprivation of Rights Under Color of Law - 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022 and 2023

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: MO Civil Rights Cases/Conspiracy Against Rights/Deprivation of Rights Under Color of Law - 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022 and 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Court document or court records related to complaint filings or lawsuit filings, prosecutions or convictions related to cases for Conspiracy Against Rights and/or Deprivation of Rights Under Color of Law in the years of 2019, 2020, 2021, 2022 and 2023 filed in Missouri Eastern District Courts, Missouri Western District Courts or Missouri Southern District Courts relating to civil rights violations by employee(s) of Missouri law enforcement agencies or any other local, state or federal law enforcement agencies.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: RE: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request #23-674
communications.communication:
Ms. Wayman and Ms. Eatinger-Sprague,

Hello,

Thanks so much for all the information. I apologize for the delay in responding. I really appreciate your time and effort in preparing and providing these records. I believe documents you’ve sent should be sufficient for now. If any additional records are needed, I will definitely contact your office first to get more details about how to word the request before submitting again. 

Again, I’m very sorry about the confusion caused by the description of documents sought in my first request. I hope filling the request was not to much of an inconvenience. I understand how it would be helpful for me to get more information about how cases are tracked and understanding which entities are the custodians for which documents before making another request.   

Thanks again for all the direction! 

Sincerely,
Kevin Hawkins

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any numerical results quantifying estimated delay time and backup length on I-5 Southbound near Woodlands as a result of Lewis Bridge repairs begun July 15,2024. Please include any reports, memoranda or otherwise pertinent department documents summarizing the anticipated traffic delay times for southbound travelers as a result of this closure.  

For reference, a press release from your department dated July 8 describing the lane closures noted that  "Traffic data shows that Friday afternoons are the worst days to travel, with delays of up to 70 minutes or longer, and backups extending beyond ten miles on southbound I-5 approaching the work zone."  [ URL: https://wsdot.wa.gov/about/news/2024/two-month-southbound-i-5-around-clock-lane-closure-woodland-begins-july-15  ]. Please provide the full data set of traffic delay times anticipated and the time of day and other variables considered.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jacob Fenton

RE: Public Disclosure Request, Reference #P015730-072424 
Dear Jacob Fenton, 

In accordance with the Public Records Act (RCW 42.56), this letter acknowledges receipt of your request for records Reference # P015730-072424, received 7/24/2024 concerning: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Any numerical results quantifying estimated delay time and backup length on I-5 Southbound near Woodlands as a result of Lewis Bridge repairs begun July 15,2024. Please include any reports, memoranda or otherwise pertinent department documents summarizing the anticipated traffic delay times for southbound travelers as a result of this closure. 

For reference, a press release from your department dated July 8 describing the lane closures noted that "Traffic data shows that Friday afternoons are the worst days to travel, with delays of up to 70 minutes or longer, and backups extending beyond ten miles on southbound I-5 approaching the work zone." [ URL: https://wsdot.wa.gov/about/news/2024/two-month-southbound-i-5-around-clock-lane-closure-woodland-begins-july-15 ]. Please provide the full data set of traffic delay times anticipated and the time of day and other variables considered. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Jacob Fenton 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fdepartment-transportation-468%252Funtitled-170105%252F%253Femail%253Dpublicdisclosurerequests%252540wsdot.wa.gov&url_auth_token=AAAXlhbWT9mG7-EtXl62vYSLWiY%3A1sWnky%3Aw0fubh3qMhCew0TkhvNTXAOCzq2Ic1lGmeAwtxaEk4I 

After reviewing your request as written and our current workload, we estimate it will take 2 months to produce all the records you are seeking. However, during that time we will release records to you in installments as they become available. 
Our procedure is to determine the office(s) where requested records are located. We then work with staff to identify and gather the responsive records. 
Once records are located and gathered, we review them for information that may be redacted based on a statutory exemption. In some cases, we may require additional time to notify a third party or consult with legal counsel. 
We will check in periodically with you to provide a status update, but please feel free to reach out at any time if you should have questions or concerns. 
We look forward to working with you, 

Rodney Treece 
Public Disclosure Coordinator 
Washington State Department of Transportation

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Albuquerque Police Department, Albuquerque, NM Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Nuisance Abatement Ordinance as described in Sec. § 11-1-1-1 of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: Your City of Albuquerque public records request #24-4317 has been opened.
communications.communication:
City of Albuquerque ************************************************************************ Your record request #24-4317 has been submitted successfully. Greetings: We have received your request for public records and will begin processing your request. This correspondence is intended to acknowledge your request and alert you that it may take up to fifteen days to process your request. NMSA 1978 14-2-8(D). We will be in contact with you as we process your request if we need additional information or if it appears that your request is excessively burdensome and broad. Additionally, please let us know if you have or later acquire documents relating to your request and upload the records into NextRequest. Such additional information has proven to be a useful resource in identifying, locating, and producing additional records. Please be advised, if you are requesting lapel and/or 911 audio from the Albuquerque Police Department (APD), your request may take a significant amount of time to review and provide the records. In lieu of the 911 audio, my office can provide the Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD). The CAD provides information of when the call was received, when and what officers were dispatched, and a description of what happens throughout the incident. In addition, please keep in mind a 5 minute lapel video can take up to 20 minutes to review depending on the type of redactions that are necessary to complete. We will be in contact to discuss ways to narrow your request but you are also welcome to contact us to discuss narrowing options. If you have or later acquire documents relating to your request, please let us know and upload the records into NextRequest. Such additional information has proven to be a useful resource in identifying, locating, and producing additional records. Please do not hesitate to contact us if you would like to know the status of your request, and please communicate all questions and status updates via NextRequest. The Office of the City Clerk reserves the right to charge an advance/deposit fee for materials related to records production and data extraction.  You may access your request by signing into your NextRequest profile at the following website:  https://nextrequest.cabq.gov/users/sign_in  Sincerely, Ethan Watson City Clerk ************************************************************************ Reply to this email or sign in to contact City of Albuquerque.

Change your email settings | Visit our help center

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Entergy Texts with Hugh McDonald
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All text messages between Secretary Hugh McDonald and Danny Games.

This request should search professional accounts and any personal accounts used for professional purposes.

Please include any administrative assistant(s) and chiefs of staff that may report to the named individual.

The timeframe of this public records request is between January 1, 2024 through July 28, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sonny Albarado, a citizen of Arkansas, in coordination with Daniel Tait.

Bondi (pbondi@americafirstpolicy.com) or any other employees of the America First Policy Institute with an email address ending "@americafirstpolicy.com. Please search for records between April 14, 2024 and present date.

Please also search for communications to and from  employees of the Arizona Secretary of State's office containing the term "America First Policy Institute" from April 14, 2024 to present date.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kira Lerner

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Awaiting Requested Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hi,

I have been awaiting information regarding FOIA Request 2022-04734 that was originally sent on 01/10/2022.  Due to no response, the request was resent on 02/18/2022 from a new email address, with a response from Ms. Shipp acknowledging the receipt of the request via the updated email address.  Ms. Richardson replied utilizing the original document email address instead of utilizing the newly provided email address that was acknowledged by Ms. Shipp.  I have followed-up on two occasions with Ms. Richardson, previously 04/24/2022 with requesting information about a response regarding FOIA Request 2022-04734 and just made a response to Ms. Richardson regarding May 16, 2022 date.  Since it is past the proposed date (May 16, 2022) by Ms. Richardson, I am willing to extend the date for an additional 5 days from today.

Below is a sample letter sent for requested information that remains the same to date.

"LaAsia Cesar 

01/10/2022

Federal Aviation Administration
Eastern Service Area Air Traffic Organization FOIA Coordinator, AJO-2E5
P.O Box 20636
Atlanta, GA 30320

 Dear FOIA Coordinator:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.

I request that a copy of the following documents to be provided to me for all aircraft via aviation that have been requested to hide, block, obscure, or limit access to aircraft registration records. Please provide information at and near 30031 Deanwood Rd. Princess Anne, MD 21853 within .25 miles radius.  Information may include Block Aircraft Registration Request (BARR List), Aircraft Situation Display to Industry (ASDI) or National Business Aviation Association (NBAA) subscriber-level blocking lists, also known as ASDI Block or NBAA Block.  Aircrafts of this search can include the altitudes of ground level (0 ft) to 15,000 ft level for aircraft on dates that are provided.  Dates requested are from February 1, 2020 to January 10, 2022; including a list of dates per aircraft flight and flight number. 

Please explain if any information has been omitted and reason to omit the requested information.

The Free Dictionary defines an “aircraft” as “a machine or device, such as an airplane, helicopter, glider, or dirigible, capable of atmospheric flight.” (aircraft, n.d.)
 
Flight information may include:

1.        Air Force Aircraft Aviation use within .25 miles

2.       Army Aviation use within .25 miles

3.       Coast Guard Aviation use within .25 miles

4.       Marine Corps Aviation use within .25 miles

5.       Navy Aviation use within .25 miles

6.       Space Force Aviation use within .25 miles

7.       Surrounding Airports Aviation use within .25 miles

8.       Police Aviation use within .25 miles

9.       Personal Aviation use within .25 miles

 

In order to determine my status to assess fees, you should know that I am an individual seeking information for personal use.  Additionally, I will be thankful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance by explaining the charges and the reason for the charges via email.

The maximum dollar amount I am willing to pay for this request is $25. Please notify me if the fees will exceed $25.00 or the maximum dollar amount I entered.  It will be a pleasure to pay for these charges electronically through the use a secure payment site.

Thank you for your consideration of this request and I look forward to reviewing your response to this request within 20 business days per the statue with FAA.

Sincerely,

LaAsia Cesar"

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

LAASIA CESAR

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Awaiting Requested Information
communications.communication:
Tis appeal letter will be sent to the :
National Freedom of Information Act Office, AFN-400
Federal Aviation Administration
800 Independence Avenue, SW
Washington, DC 20591
(202) 267-9165

Re: FOIA Request 2022-04734

Dear FOIA Representative,

This is an appeal pursuant to 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(1990), concerning information at and near 30031 Deanwood Road, Princess Anne, MD, 21853 within a .25 miles radius, to include ASDI, BARR list and NBAA Block records from February 1, 2020 to January 10, 2022. The response from an FOIA Representative was provided stating that “FOIA Exemption 3. FOIA Exemption 3 permits withholding of records specifically exempted from disclosure by another Federal statute. In this instance, 10 USC § 130e states, in part, that the Department of Defense (DOD) may exempt critical infrastructure security information where such disclosure would reveal vulnerabilities that, if exploited, would likely result in the significant disruption, destruction, or damage of or to DOD operations, property or facilities. In a letter dated June 2, 2017, the DOD informed the FAA that DOD flight data constitutes DOD Critical Infrastructure Information (DCRIT) and is therefore exempt from disclosure in accordance with this statute” signed by Virginia Boyle Vice President, System Operations Services Air Traffic Organization and emailed by Angella Martin-Osorio.

Some alleged laws have been included regarding the redacted information:
1.  Section 242 of Title 18 
2.  Privacy Act of 1974 
3.  The Posse Comitatus Act
4.  The Insurrection Act of 1807 
5.  18 U.S. Code § 1113
6.  Redacted information does not coincide with the 16 different critical infrastructures
7.  Additional information about laws and regulations have been provided via the attached appeal document.

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Colorado LIHTC QCs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all requests or applications for qualified contracts for LIHTC developments submitted to the Colorado Housing and Finance Authority, including the following:

1) The year of the application or request
2) The projects's name, full address, and ownership
3) The qualified contract price
4) The total number of units covered
5) The outcome of the request and start and end dates of the deregulation period, if one ensued
6) Any information retained by the agency on the requester or applicant, including their name, contact information, and organizational affiliation

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rebecca Burns

communications.subject: RE: CORA Request | Colorado LIHTC QCs
communications.communication:
Good afternoon,

Thank you for your patience while we researched your CORA request.

CHFA’s Qualified Allocation Plan (QAP) requires applicants to waive their right to request a Qualified Contract. Therefore, it is not a current practice to collect and retain Qualified Contracts. To the best of our knowledge, before this requirement in the QAP, three requests for Qualified Contracts were made, and one request was pursued by the owner. Based on CHFA’s record retention policy, that document is no longer on file with CHFA.

The list you requested is not an existing document, however, attached is the recorded termination agreement of the Land Use Restrictive Agreement (LURA) of the one development that pursued a Qualified Contract.

If you have any further questions, please reach out to Matt Lynn, CHFA’s media liaison, for any further assistance.

Paul


Paul Schumacher
Staff Attorney
Legal and Risk Management
Colorado Housing and Finance Authority
1981 Blake Street
Denver, CO 80202
www.chfainfo.com<http://www.chfainfo.com/>
303.297.7471 direct

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: OFL Reorganization
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I was seeking any documents in the offices of former Attorney General Jefferson Sessions or any of his deputies about the reorganization of the 'Offices of Foreign Litigation' including but not limited to the removal of the UK office address from the Department of Justice Website.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

William Fernandes

Sara Tennant

title: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
tags: clover park school board member paul wagemann
clover park school board member carole jacobs
clover park school board member anthony veliz
clover park school board member alyssa anderson pearson
clover park school board member dr. marty schafer

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record. 

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

communications.subject: Re: Washington Public Records Act Request: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Dear PRA Audit,



The Clover Park School District received your public records request on November 5, 2021. Your request seeks all public records requests received by the District from January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021, as well as a complete electronic copy of the District’s responses to those requests.



You have requested “electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE format for each record.” The vast majority of records the District has disclosed in response to public records requests since 2010 have not been produced in native format, and instead were produced in formats such as .pdf. And as noted earlier, you have requested “a complete electronic copy of the District’s Responses” to public records requests during the time period in question, and such responses typically did not contain native format records. In light of this conflict, the District interprets your request as seeking the District’s previous disclosure communications in their native format, recognizing that those disclosure communications will often contain non-native files. For example, the District would produce to you the native format email of its response to a given public records request, which may include attached responsive records in pdf format that were actually produced to a requestor. Please let me know if you disagree with this interpretation of your request.



Next, please be aware that the District may no longer possess copies of older public records requests and/or District responses. In that event, the District would be unable to disclose copies of such requests and responses.



Per District Procedure 4040P and RCW 42.56.120, the District charges the following fees for electronic copies of records:



1.     Ten cents per page for public records scanned into an electronic format or for the use of district equipment to scan the records;

2.     Five cents per each four electronic files or attachments uploaded to email, cloud-based data storage service, or other means of electronic delivery;

3.     Ten cents per gigabyte for the transmission of public records in an electronic format or for the use of district equipment to send the records electronically; and

4.     The actual cost of any digital storage media or device provided by the district, the actual cost of any container or envelope used to mail the copies to the requestor, and the actual postage or delivery charge.



Any applicable copying costs must be received by the District before the District discloses records. Additionally, District Procedure 4040P and RCW 42.56.120 authorize the District to require a deposit of up to ten percent of the total estimated costs of providing copies for a request. The District has not yet had an opportunity to determine how many responsive records there will be, or what the total estimated cost of fulfilling the request will be. Prior to providing the first installment of records for this request, we will contact you to let you know the total estimated cost and the deposit amount due. Following receipt of the deposit, the District will require payment of any applicable copying costs before producing installments.



At this time, the District estimates that it will be able to disclose an initial installment of records by February 4, 2022. I have also submitted your request to our NextRequest Program on November 5, 2021, at 3:29 pm. This will also include our 5-day response from our District.


Thank you.



Aranka Holmes

Coordinator for Public Records, WC Claims, and ADA

[cid:b525986e-eb5d-4ccc-9e3e-be0e3be9d7ee]

Creating Promising Futures.



Student Services Center

10903 Gravelly Lake Dr SW, Lakewood WA  98499-1341

253-583-5083 •  Fax 253-583-5088



IMPORTANT NOTICE: This e-mail message and all attachments, if any, may contain confidential and privileged material and are intended only for the person or entity to which the message is addressed. If you are not an intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, disclosure, or copying of this information is unauthorized and strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please contact the sender immediately by reply e-mail, and destroy all copies of the original message.

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Clover Park School District public records request #21-119

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Clover Park School District public records request #21-119
communications.communication:
Clover Park School District ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #21-119: Hello,   The District is currently processing your request and will have the first installment produced to you on February 15, 2022.   I am writing for clarification regarding you request for a “complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010, through November 4, 2021.” As background, the District processes requests for records under the Public Records Act (PRA), Chapter 42.56 RCW and requests for records under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), 34 C.F.R 99, within the same program. FERPA provides families certain rights with regard to their students’ education records, including the ability to review and request their student’s education records. See 34 C.F.R. 99.10. Because the District processes both PRA requests and FERPA requests through the same system, many requests by parents to view their student records have been labelled PRA requests, when in actuality, they were FERPA requests. This means many of the sets of records that appear to have been produced under the PRA were actually produced under FERPA. For example, the first installment to you of responsive records will include about eighty requests for records. Of those 80 requests, 30 sets of records were requested under FERPA, while the rest were requested under the PRA.   The District would like you to clarify whether you are seeking those requests for records which would qualify as FERPA requests, or if you are purely seeking the records produced under the PRA.   The information you requested is unable to be emailed due to size; however, we have copied the requested items onto a flash drive. The cost of the flash drive is as follows:            Thumb/CD drive         $6.00            Postage                           .50           Shipping container      $1.00                                               $7.50   In the event you wish to pick up the thumb drive, you would just be charged for the thumb drive. Otherwise, we will mail the contents to you once payment is received. We accept either cash (needs to be exact change) or check (made payable to Clover Park School District). Please contact me at aholmes@cloverpark.k12.wa.us if you have any questions.   This is the District’s final notice that if you do not provide clarification on these requests, the District will close your request on March 15, 2022. RCW 42.46.520(3)(b); WAC 44-14-04003(8).   Thanks,     Aranka Holmes Human Resources Coordinator for Public Records, WC Claims, and ADA Creating Promising Futures.   Student Services Center 10903 Gravelly Lake Dr SW, Lakewood WA 98499-1341 253-583-5083 • Fax 253-583-5088   IMPORTANT NOTICE: This e-mail message and all attachments, if any, may contain confidential and privileged material and are intended only for the person or entity to which the message is addressed. If you are not an intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, disclosure, or copying of this information is unauthorized and strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please contact the sender immediately by reply e-mail, and destroy all copies of the original message   ************************************************************************ Questions about your request? Reply to this email or sign in to contact staff at Clover Park School District.

communications.subject: Re: Washington Public Records Act Request: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021
communications.communication:
Hello,



The District is currently processing your request and will have the first installment produced to you on February 15, 2022.



I am writing for clarification regarding your request for a “complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010, through November 4, 2021.” As background, the District processes requests for records under the Public Records Act (PRA), Chapter 42.56 RCW, and requests for records under the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA), 34 C.F.R 99, within the same program. FERPA provides families certain rights with regard to their students’ education records, including the ability to review and request their student’s education records. See 34 C.F.R. 99.10. Because the District processes both PRA requests and FERPA requests through the same system, many requests by parents to view their student records have been labeled PRA requests when in actuality, they were FERPA requests. This means many of the sets of records that appear to have been produced under the PRA were actually produced under FERPA. For example, the first installment to you of responsive records will include about eighty requests for records. Of those 80 requests, 30 sets of records were requested under FERPA, while the rest were requested under the PRA.



The District would like you to clarify whether you are seeking those requests for records which would qualify as FERPA requests, or if you are purely seeking the records produced under the PRA.



The information you requested is unable to be emailed due to size; however, we have copied the requested items onto a flash drive. The cost of the flash drive is as follows:

           Thumb/CD drive         $6.00

           Postage                           .50

          Shipping container       $1.00

                                               $7.50



In the event you wish to pick up the thumb drive, you would just be charged for the thumb drive. Otherwise, we will mail the contents to you once payment is received.

We accept either cash (needs to be exact change) or check (made payable to Clover Park School District). Please contact me at aholmes@cloverpark.k12.wa.us if you have any questions.



This is the District’s final notice that if you do not provide clarification on these requests, the District will close your request on March 15, 2022. RCW 42.46.520(3)(b); WAC 44-14-04003(8).



Thanks,



Aranka Holmes

Coordinator for Public Records, WC Claims, and ADA

[cid:7dd5901c-6d2f-4cd0-92bb-5c517231e465]

Creating Promising Futures.



Student Services Center

10903 Gravelly Lake Dr SW, Lakewood WA  98499-1341

253-583-5083 •  Fax 253-583-5088



IMPORTANT NOTICE: This e-mail message and all attachments, if any, may contain confidential and privileged material and are intended only for the person or entity to which the message is addressed. If you are not an intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any use, dissemination, distribution, disclosure, or copying of this information is unauthorized and strictly prohibited. If you have received this communication in error, please contact the sender immediately by reply e-mail, and destroy all copies of the original message.

________________________________
From: 120962-77980939@requests.muckrock.com <120962-77980939@requests.muckrock.com>
Sent: Thursday, November 4, 2021 10:00 PM
To: Aranka Holmes <aholmes@cloverpark.k12.wa.us>
Subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Clover Park School District – Request for a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by the District including District Responses for the years 2010 - 2021

________________________________

**Clover Park School District cannot be held responsible for the content of this email, as it has originated from an outside source.**

________________________________

Clover Park School District
Washington Public Records Act Office
ATTN: Public Records Officer
10903 Gravelly Lake Drive SW
Lakewood, WA 98499

November 5, 2021

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act [RCW 42.56] I hereby request the following records:

I request a complete electronic copy of all Public Records Requests received by Clover Park School District and a complete electronic copy of the District's Responses to these Public Records Requests for the time period January 1, 2010 through November 4, 2021.

In the event the District chooses to provide these records in installments over time I request the records to be produced in reverse chronological order - from the most recent records to the earliest.

If this request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the PRA. I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

For each responsive record the District contends is exempt from public disclosure, in whole or in part, please specifically identify the record by subject, title, author, custodian and date, and state how a specific statutory exemption applies to each record as required by RCW 42.56.210(3) and Rental Housing Ass'n v. Des Moines, 165 Wn.2d 525, 199 P.3d 393 (2009).

I request electronic production of all electronic records in the original NATIVE electronic format for each record.

I request for these public records to be produced by public (no password) e-mail attachment or link. If electronic attachment or link is not possible, an alternative would be to produce responsive records via USB DRIVE or DATA CD-ROM.

THIS REQUEST IS NOT BEING MADE FOR COMMERCIAL PURPOSES.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PRA Audit

View request history, upload responsive documents, and report problems here:
https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fclover-park-school-district-29076%252Fclover-park-school-district-request-for-a-complete-electronic-copy-of-all-public-records-requests-received-by-the-district-including-district-responses-for-the-years-2010-2021-120962%252F%253Femail%253Daholmes%252540cloverpark.k12.wa.us&url_auth_token=AAEh6VwwsgaoUdh9_X_gcfQrZAw%3A1mirLN%3A_qRCmflGW8qyMbq9BLpucwXsduA

Filed via MuckRock.com
E-mail (Preferred): 120962-77980939@requests.muckrock.com

For mailed responses, please address (see note):
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 120962
411A Highland Ave
Somerville, MA 02144-2516

PLEASE NOTE: This request is not filed by a MuckRock staff member, but is being sent through MuckRock by the above in order to better track, share, and manage public records requests. Also note that improperly addressed (i.e., with the requester's name rather than "MuckRock News" and the department number) requests might be returned as undeliverable.

Please note that in accordance with the Washington Secretary of State Retention Schedule, the District is not required to retain “records created in the activity of responding to public records requests in accordance with the Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW)” for more than two years, with limited exceptions. I have included the Washington State Government General Records Retention Schedule, Version 6.2 (August 2021) with this response for your review. See Section 5.4, Public Disclosure/Records Request, Disposition Authority Number GS 05001 Rev. 2, at pg. 114. You have requested Public Records Requests and Responses dating back to 2010. Consistent with the applicable retention schedule, the district does not have Public Records Requests and Responses dating back that far and have now provided you the records responsive to your request. Thank you, Aranka Holmes Coordinator for Public Records, WC Claims, ADA, and FMLA   Creating Promising Futures.   Student Services Center 10903 Gravelly Lake Dr. SW, Lakewood WA 98499-1341 253-583-5083 • Fax 253-583-5088   IMPORTANT NOTICE: This e-mail message and all attachments, if any, may contain confidential and privileged material and are intended only for the person or entity to which the message is addressed.
