title: Assistant Secretary Catherine Lhamon December 2021 Calendar

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Assistant Secretary Catherine Lhamon December 2021 Calendar
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Assistant Secretary Catherine Lhamon's public calendar for December 2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

communications.subject: Department of Education FOIA Acknowledgment Letter - 22-01812-F
communications.communication:
Dear Russel   Neiss, 

This is the Department's acknowledgment of your request for information pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. § 552. Your request was forwarded to the primary responsible office(s) for action. 

Any future correspondence or questions regarding your request, please contact the FOIA Public Liaison at 202-401-8365 or Thank you. (mailto:EDFOIAManager@ed.gov) EDFOIAManager@ed.gov 

ED FOIA Manager 
FOIA Service Center 
U.S. Department of Education

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #22-01812-F
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Feb. 2, 2022. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #22-01812-F.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: 22-01812-F Status Update
communications.communication:
Good Afternoon, 
This e-mail is in response to your request for a status on the subject FOIA requests: # 22-01812-F 
The Department receives an overwhelming amount of FOIA requests, some of which are complex and voluminous that requires a line-by-line review of hundreds or even thousands of pages of documents.  Requests are processed on a first-in-first-out basis. Your request is currently with the program office tasked to search/produce records responsive to your request. 
Please continue check on the status of your request on the Department’s FOIA Web page at http://www2.ed.gov/policy/gen/leg/foia/foiatoc.html and click on the Requests Status Log link under “More Resources.” 
If you have any questions, please contact the FOIA Service Center at (202) 401-8365 or via e-mail at EDFOIAManager@ed.gov. 
Thank You, 
Brittany Davis 
FOIA Service Center 
US Department of Education 
(202) 401-8365

title: UT Austin Arrest of Photojournalist, April 24, 2025 (Texas Department of Public Safety)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: UT Austin Arrest of Photojournalist, April 24, 2025 (Texas Department of Public Safety)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any recording (including audio or video captured by body camera, vehicular camera, or handheld device) of the detention of Carlos, a photojournalist employed by FOX 7, on April 24, 2024, at or near UT Austin. For any recording of the detention, please include any audio or video captured five minutes before his detention and twenty minutes after the recording captured any audio or video of his detention.

2. Any report concerning the arrest or interaction with Carlos on April 24, 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Public Information :: P000753-042624
communications.communication:
Dear Adam Steinbaugh: 
Your request has been received and is being processed within state law. Your request was received in this office and given the reference number P000753-042624 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Requested: the arrest or interaction records with Carlos a FOX photojournalist at the UT protests. 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant division(s) to locate the requested information and to determine any costs associated with producing the requested records. You will receive a response as soon as the requested records are available, no later than the tenth business day after your request was received. 
You can monitor the progress of your request at the link below and you'll receive an email when your request has been completed. 
 
 
Texas Department of Public Safety 
 
 
To monitor the progress or update this request please log into the Public Information Center (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=u001.VEsWrlMiJDg0mXafq1mEXcWyyIcZbRW2MUSaQXXb476R4Uz5WL9-2FNC2ma7VNSqQRYytpv5-2F29venOQGR8nKmDA-3D-3DYMvT_5ilMYl0Rt7lH8dWTWb9FjzDYSAJSKaKfoQspeKj-2B5ZApcRWkpjLrdHyTFhz5g9AqkZROoxyFSrtRZhl3SOUALIEFF0NZ-2BO-2B1kdbfyVOL05mq-2F8Z8Slj1vJiEH8-2FfUVLopUDAo8mt2-2BCKGPbdhDj5O-2Be-2Bh-2B4iYN1v4VpL-2Fs5UYIwX7zuhIheQhRT9-2B-2Fvbgthb6L7LxTnnv6HQdsREV3uGM7MqJqO-2FHU-2FbJjdriFvv0vE-3D)

--- Please respond above this line --- 

RE: PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST of April 25, 2024., Reference # P000610-042524. 
Dear Adam Steinbaugh, 
The Texas Department of Public Safety received a public information request from you on April 25, 2024. Your request mentioned: "any communications related to the concerning the April 24, 2024 demonstrations at Texas universities, including UT Austin and UT San Antonio" 
DPS has located records responsive to your request; however, we believe these records may be excepted from required public disclosure at this time.  DPS is seeking a ruling from the Office of the Attorney General (OAG) with respect to disclosure of these records, and a copy of our request letter is attached.  You will be notified directly by the OAG when a ruling is issued. 
If you have any questions or need additional information, please submit your response through this portal. 
Sincerely, 
Christina Lee 
Assistant General Counsel 
OGC

title: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT - Request for digital copies of all internet video call recordings in the District's care, custody, or control recorded between the dates 01-01-20 through 05-01-24

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT - Request for digital copies of all internet video call recordings in the District's care, custody, or control recorded between the dates 01-01-20 through 05-01-24
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Digital copies of all video recordings of internet-based video calls, meetings, training sessions, town halls, school board meetings, and google classroom sessions in the District's care, custody, or control recorded between the dates 01-01-20 through 05-01-24.

To clarify, if the District is in possession of any digital recordings of Zoom meeting calls, Skype Sessions, Google Duo calls, Slack, Gotomeeting, etc. (any recorded internet-based video communication/presentation/instruction product) for the period of time 01-01-20 through 05-01-24 I am requesting a digital copy to be produced via internet web link.

The District search for these digitally recorded videos should include all computers and digital storage devices owned, operated, or controlled by the District.

The District search for these digitally recorded videos should also include a search of all computers and digital storage devices owned, operated, or controlled by District employees if the digital video was recorded on equipment provided to the employee by the District, or if the digital video recording contains content relating to District agency related matters.

I request the digital video files to be delivered unedited whenever possible and in the original digital file format in which the files were originally recorded and stored.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anon Request

communications.subject: RE: Washington Public Records Act Request: LAKE WASHINGTON SCHOOL DISTRICT - Request for digital copies of all internet video call recordings in the District's care, custody, or control recorded between the dates 01-01-20 through 05-01-24
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor,
This letter confirms that the District has received your request on today's date. Pursuant to RCW 42.56.040(1)(c) et seq., I acknowledge your request. This letter serves as the response required by the Public Records Act, RCW 42.56.520.

At this time, the District estimates that it will be able to produce an installment of these documents within the next six months.

Under the Public Disclosure Act, districts may not charge for locating documents or for inspection. The district will assess a fee of .15 cents per page for any copying.

If you have any questions or concerns, please contact me at 425-936-1147 or via e-mail at publicrecordsrequest@lwsd.org.

Jesse Burnham, J.D.
Compliance Investigator
Risk and Safety Services, LWSD
jburnham@lwsd.org<mailto:jburnham@lwsd.org> | (425) 936-1147

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Baton Rouge ShotSpotter Contract
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The most recent contract (i.e. council resolution, contract extension, contract amendments, cure notices, or other revisions to agreements) between the city and SoundThinking, Inc., formerly ShotSpotter, Inc.. This document(s) should include the total cost over the life of the contract and the current expiration date.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sophia Ludt

communications.subject: Police Request :: P004867-062524
communications.communication:
Dear Sophia Ludt: 
Thank you for visiting the City of Baton Rouge Public Records Center.  We are in receipt of your request for records.  We will process your request; once your records are available, we will alert your office. Due to high volume of requests received by our office, please allow at least thirty days for production of any records that may be available.  Your request was received in this office on 6/25/2024 and assigned the reference number P004867-062524 for tracking purposes.

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
08/05/2024 
Miriam Bhimani 
Dear Miriam: 
RE: Chicago Public Schools FOIA Request N015870-072024 
Thank you for using the Chicago Public Schools FOIA Center. You requested the following: 
To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records: 

Please supply the full personnel files of the following individuals: 

* Remus Galvin, Assistant Principal, Airforce Academy 
* Onome Omovie, Assistant Principal, Carvery Military Academy 
* Charessa Maiden-McNeal, Assistant Principal, Chicago Military Academy 
* Charles Malek, Assistant Principal, Phoenix Military 

This includes any resumes, applications, any job recommendations, promotions, professional license credentials and verification records. Please include a work/salary history. Please include any investigative materials - investigative memorandums, disciplinary actions (suspensions, leaves of absence that stem from disciplinary action), incident reports, EOCO investigations, Office of Civil Rights determinations, non-disciplinary memorandum of understandings, non-union misconduct form, full warning resolutions and any complaints or claims/lawsuits/settlements. Please include any safety plans. Please include any separation agreements and any other disclosure agreements. 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Miriam Bhimani 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fchicago-public-schools-3121%252Fassistant-principals-military-academies-169727%252F%253F&url_auth_token=AAATZ6_n4zL9LUQrOAhSu0BQ7O8%3A1sV3hf%3A4nM1Kq-MFspq5wGjRSmmO7YY5GnpNiah7-ykP-fhnYk 
RESPONSE: Documents responsive to your request are available to download via the CPS FOIA Center at www.cps.edu/FOIARequests . Please log in with your username and password to access the records. Please note that certain private information (personal descriptions, employee ID numbers, college transcripts, social security numbers, citizenship status, signatures, personal addresses, medical information, etc.) was redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7. Specifically, section 7(1)(b) which exempts certain private information as defined by section 2(c-5) and section 7(1)(c) which exempts personal information contained within public records, the disclosure of which would constitute a clearly unwarranted invasion of personal privacy, unless the disclosure is consented to in writing by the individual subject of the information. “Unwarranted invasion of personal privacy” means the disclosure of information that is highly personal or objectionable to a reasonable person and in which the subject’s right to privacy outweighs any legitimate public interest in obtaining the information. 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a) exempts “ information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State Law … ” (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) Specifically, 105 ILCS 5/10-21.9 (b) states that “ any information concerning the record of convictions obtained by the president of the school board or the regional superintendent shall be confidential and may only be transmitted to the superintendent of the school district or his designee, the appropriate regional superintendent if the check was requested by the school district, the presidents of the appropriate school boards if the check was requested from the Department of State Police by the regional superintendent, the State Superintendent of Education, the State Teacher Certification Board, any other person necessary to the decision of hiring the applicant for employment, or for clarification purposes the Department of State Police or Statewide Sex Offender Database, or both.” 
Portions of this request that include personnel evaluations are redacted entirely in accordance with section 7(1)(a) of FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a)) which exempts from public release information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law and also in accordance with section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)) which exempts from public release information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.] Certain records are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(f) as factual information inextricably intertwined in ongoing investigation and processes as well as 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(n), which exempts from release records relating to the adjudication of employee discipline and grievance matters except for records reflecting the final outcome. Section 7.5(h) exempts from disclosure “information the disclosure of which is exempted under the State Officials and Employees Ethics Act, and records of any lawfully created State or local inspector general’s office that would be exempt if created or obtained by an Executive Inspector General’s office.” 5 ILCS 140/7.5(h). Records of discipline more than four years old are exempt from disclosure pursuant to section 7.5(q) of the FOIA (5 ILCS 140/7.5(q)), which exempts information prohibited from being disclosed by the Personnel Records Review Act [820 ILCS 40/0.01 et seq.]. 820 ILCS 40/8 of the Personnel Records Review Act states that “an employer shall review a personnel record before releasing information to a third party and, except when the release is ordered to a party in a legal action or arbitration, delete disciplinary reports, letters of reprimand, or other records of disciplinary action which are more than 4 years old.” Student information has been redacted pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7.5 (r) which exempts from inspection or copying information prohibited from being disclosed by the Illinois School Student Records Act (ISSRA). ISSRA generally prohibits the disclosure of “school student records” and defines a “school student record” as “any writing or other recorded information concerning a student and by which a student may be individually identified, maintained by a school or at is direction or by an employee of a school, regardless of how or where the information is stored.” (105 ILCS 10/2(d). Certain incident report entries related to this request are being withheld entirely pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/7(1)(a). This section exempts from disclosure information specifically prohibited from disclosure by federal or State law or rules and regulations implementing federal or State law. Specifically, the Abused and Neglected Child Reporting Act, section 325 ILCS 5/1, states that all records concerning reports of child abuse and neglect or records concerning referrals under this Act and all records generated as a result of such reports or referrals, shall be confidential and shall not be disclosed except as specifically authorized by this Act or other applicable law; and 820 ILCS 40/13 of the Illinois Personnel Records Review Act, which prohibits the identification of individuals who are the subject of an unfounded DCFS report. You have a right to have the denial of your request reviewed by the Public Access Counselor (PAC) at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). You can file your Request for Review with the PAC by writing to: Leah Bartelt; Public Access Counselor Office of the Attorney General 500 South 2nd Street Springfield, Illinois 62706 E-mail: public.access@ilag.gov 877-299-3642 You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the State circuit court. 5 ILCS 140/11. If you choose to file a Request for Review with the PAC, you must do so within 60 calendar days of the date of this denial letter. 5 ILCS 140/9.5(a). Please note that you must include a copy of your original FOIA request and this denial letter when filing a Request for Review with the PAC. Sincerely, Patricia Majchrowicz Freedom of Information Act Officer Chicago Public Schools

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: MassDOT Charge Fast Power Communications
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide any documents, communications, emails, etc. from the Massachusetts Department of Transportation from 2022 to present that include the words "David Ortiz," "Big Papi," "Charge Fast," "Nora Delgado," or "Diego Bentz." Relevant email communications may include correspondence with email address(es) that include "@chargefastus.com" or "chargefastpower.com."

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chris Faraone

title: Public Information Request: Flock Safety Raven Side-by-Side Comparison

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Public Information Request: Flock Safety Raven Side-by-Side Comparison
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

According to the Flock Safety website, Spring Branch ISD conducted a side-by-side comparison with of Flock Safety's Raven audio detection devices with a competitors tool. The site states, "While the school has had gunshot detection systems from another vendor, Baimbridge was not convinced they were the best choice. He agreed to a test of the Flock Safety Raven® audio detection devices, putting them next to the other vendor’s devices for a side-by-side comparison. In the first five days the Flock Safety Raven® devices identified three incidents of gunshots that the other vendor’s system did not detect. That early warning system, paired with LPR cameras could be key to preventing school violence, the chief said."

Source: https://www.flocksafety.com/resources/how-spring-branch-independent-school-district-is-stopping-crime-with-a-flock-safety-falcon-and-raven-system

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records related to the side-by-side comparison of Flock Safety's Raven product and the other vendor's devices discussed on the website linked above:

1. Documents sufficient to show all meeting minutes, reports, slide decks, presentations, and work products related to the side-by-side comparison. 
2. Documents sufficient to show all planning documents prepared before conducting the side-by-side comparison.
3. A copy of all data collected during the duration of the side-by-side comparison.
4. Documents sufficient to show all Spring Branch ISD and Flock Safety personnel who participated in planning, conducting, and analyzing the side-by-side comparison.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

e

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Poor Windy Protest / Treesit
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to ORS 192.314, which provides that every person has the right to inspect any nonexempt public record of a public body in Oregon, I am writing to request the following public records from the Josephine County Sheriff office:

Any  records, including but not limited to email communication, phone logs, police reports, or text/sms messages, regarding the protest or "tree sit" in the Bureau of Land Management's Poor Windy project and the law enforcement response between April 1, 2024 and the date that this request is honored. Beyond just internal communication, I am requesting an relevant records regarding communication and coordination with federal agencies including but not limited to the Bureau of Land Management, Federal Bureau of Investigation, and Homeland Security. 

As an independent journalist, I request that any fees associated with honoring this request are waived, as access to these public records are in the public benefit and I will use my platforms to disseminate the records widely. These records are critical for public understanding of law enforcement perception and response to constitutionally protected protest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

J Kehrer

communications.subject: FOIA Response
communications.communication:
The City in is receipt of your FOIA Request referenced above.  The City has reviewed your request and responds as follows:


  1.  Use of Force policy for the Macomb Police Department.  The policies are attached per your request.

With the provision of these records, the City considers this matter closed.  As the requestor, you have a right to review of the City's determination by the Public Access Counselor.  The Public Access Counselor may be contacted at the Office of the Illinois Attorney General, 100 W. Randolph St., 12th Floor, Chicago, Illinois 60601, (312) 814-3000.  You also have the right to seek judicial review of your denial by filing a lawsuit in the state circuit court pursuant to 5 ILCS 140/11.

Sincerely,

City Attorney/FOIA Officer

communications.subject: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. All email correspondence, with attachments, mentioning "Water Property Investors," "Water Property Investor II," or "Water Property Investor III." 

2. Pitch decks, prospectuses, or any other materials provided to NMERB by the the above funds for consideration of potential investments.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Julia Rock

communications.subject: Fw: [EXTERNAL] New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Records Requestor:


Your request for information from the New Mexico Educational Retirement Board was forwarded to me. In accordance with the New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act (IPRA), “a written request shall provide the name, address and telephone number of the person seeking access to the records and shall identify the records sought with reasonable particularity.” Section 14-2-8(C) NMSA 1978.


If you will provide me with your name and mailing address, we can begin the process of allowing inspection of the relevant records.


The Inspection of Public Records Act can be found at 14-2-1 through 14-2-12 NMSA 1978.


Thank you.


Amanda Olsen



Amanda Olsen, Paralegal
NM Educational Retirement Board
PO Box 26129
Santa Fe, New Mexico 87502
(505) 476 6133
(505) 827-8030 fax



Confidentiality: The information contained in this e-mail and any attachment(s) hereto is confidential and may be legally privileged. This email and any attachment(s) is intended only for the recipient(s) identified above. communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for your response! My name is Rebecca Burns and my colleague Julia Rock and I are reporters at The Lever, a national investigative outlet. I am making this request as part of ongoing reporting into water issues in the American West. This request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

My mailing address is 4521 N Central Park Ave. 3W, Chicago IL 60625. My phone number is 781-962-8816. Please feel free to give me a call if it's helpful to discuss any portion of this request. 

Thank you!

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Scroggins and Ms. Olsen,

Thanks for the update. Can you provide any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request, or the estimated delivery date? Please feel free to give me a call at 781-962-8816 if it'd be helpful to discuss the scope of the materials we're requesting.

communications.subject: RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock,

I am responding to your email yesterday requesting any additional info regarding the source of delays on this request. Please be assured that we make every effort to respond promptly to every request. However, we must also ensure that we are diligent and accurate in our reply. Thus, when obtained, all documents and emails must be reviewed. Additionally, we must rely on the state agency that controls the entire state email system to identify and provide the emails requested. As you can imagine, the process takes time.

As to an estimated response date, in our letter of August 1, 2023, we noted that we intend to respond by September 6, 2023.

Thank you for your patience and please feel free to contact me if you have further questions.

Respectfully,

[cid:image001.png@01D9C623.0D3F7D80]

communications.communication:
Hello Ms. Garcia,

Thank you for the update. Given that it's now been five months since we filed the initial request, are you able to provide an update as to whether you've identified the responsive documents, or what the source of the delay is?

Thank you,

Rebecca

communications.subject: ATTORNEY CLIENT PRIVILEGED - RE: [EXTERNAL] RE: New Mexico Inspection of Public Records Act Request: Water Asset Management funds correspondence
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns,

Thank you for your inquiry and please accept our apologies for the delay.

As Mr. Scroggins noted in his August 3, 2023 email regarding our projected response, we always try to be prompt.  But as you might guess, the request references a large number of records.  As he said, we must thoroughly review all records to identify and obtain the responsive documents from both external and internal sources.  It is a complex and time-consuming process.

I am confident that we will have documents ready to provide on or before the December 6th, 2023, date noted in our recent communication.

Thank you for your continued patience!
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image002.png@01DA121F.C2136CB0]

files.title: image002
files.source: New Mexico Educational Retirement Board, New Mexico

Thanks so much for your help with this request! I really appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Julia Rock

communications.subject: Re: Request for Inspection of Records
communications.communication:
Dear Ms. Rock and Ms. Burns:

As discussed in our letter of December 6, 2023, we are providing the records we currently have available in response to your June 16, 2023, request.  They are located at the website below:

MuckRock - Julia Rock<https://nmgov-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/r/personal/renee_garcia_erb_nm_gov/Documents/MuckRock%20-%20Julia%20Rock?csf=1&web=1&e=4gwfSH>

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records.  We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024.  Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee



[cid:image001.png@01DA29F0.5D899B00]

We apologize for the error you received while trying to access the records. We will be using another method for delivery. Attached are the instructions that you will need to connect to the ERB SFTP server.  I will send you the credentials in a secure email to follow this.

As also discussed, we will require additional time to provide the remainder of the records. We plan to provide additional documents on or before February 1, 2024. Thank you again for your continued patience regarding this matter.
Regards,
Renee

title: Last 20 emails sent by Iowa gymnastics coach Larissa Libby

communications.subject: Iowa Open Records Law Request: Last 20 emails sent by Iowa gymnastics coach Larissa Libby
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Iowa Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The final twenty emails sent by Iowa gymnastics coach Larissa Libby prior to her May 2024 resignation.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Welsh

communications.subject: RE: [External] Iowa Open Records Law Request: Last 20 emails sent by Iowa gymnastics coach Larissa Libby
communications.communication:
Hello again, Ben,

This is to confirm receipt of your request for Coach Larissa Libby's emails.

In order for us to process this request, could you please provide a date range? We will pull all emails sent on those dates. Then, once the records have been retrieved, we will need to review the emails for any confidential information. If it is estimated to take more than one hour to retrieve and review the emails, I will send you an invoice, in accordance with our fee schedule<https://transparency.uiowa.edu/faqs/public-records-fee-schedule>.

Thanks,
Aubree


Aubree Johnson
Public Records Officer
The University of Iowa
351 Plaza Centre One
Iowa City, IA 52242
public-records@uiowa.edu<mailto:public-records@uiowa.edu>

NOTICE TO RECIPIENT: THIS MESSAGE AND ANY RESPONSE TO IT MAY CONSTITUTE A PUBLIC RECORD, AND THEREFORE, MAY BE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST IN ACCORDANCE WITH IOWA PUBLIC RECORDS LAW, IOWA CODE CHAPTER 22.

Ben,

To retrieve a sufficient quantity of emails (of at least 20), we used a date range going back to April 1, 2024 and pulled all emails sent by Coach Libby since that date. Attached are the records pulled from that search which are subject to disclosure in accordance with Iowa Code Chapter 22.

We will consider this request complete.

title: Complaints from Greenhouse and Plant Nursery Workers

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Complaints from Greenhouse and Plant Nursery Workers
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All complaints concerning heat and high temperatures submitted to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration from farmworkers who work in greenhouses and plant nurseries, between May 1st, 2023 and the date that this request is processed. 

I'm a journalist with Civil Eats, and this information will be used to further my reporting in the public interest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Grey Moran

communications.subject: Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Hello:

Your request has been assigned to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) with tracking number 2024-F-10372. When they begin processing it, you will be able to track its progress at https://efoia.dol.gov/App/CheckStatus.aspx. If you need to contact them about it for any reason, please submit your inquiry through osha.foia@dol.gov<mailto:osha.foia@dol.gov> or phone 202-693-1999. In addition, it would be helpful to include the tracking number in the Subject line of any email submission to have it available at the time of the call.

Sincerely,

Arginia Karamoko
Government Information Specialist, Office of Information Services
Office of the Solicitor | Management & Administrative Legal Services
U.S. DEPARTMENT OF LABOR
200 Constitution Ave., N.W., N-2420 | Washington, DC  20210
T: (202) 693-5531 | F: (202) 693-5389 |  E: karamoko.arginia@dol.gov<mailto:karamoko.arginia@dol.gov>

files.title: ~WRD0002
files.source: Occupational Safety and Health Administration, United States of America

communications.subject: 10372 - FOIA Acknowledgement
communications.communication:
Dear Mr. Moran:

This letter is to acknowledge receipt of your May 24, 2024, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request, which was received in the Occupational Safety and Health Administration's (OSHA), Directorate of Enforcement Programs (DEP) for response.  Please reference FOIA tracking number 2024-F-10372 in any future correspondence concerning this request.

You request the following:

All complaints concerning heat and high temperatures submitted to the Occupational Safety and Health Administration from farmworkers who work in greenhouses and plant nurseries between May 1, 2023, and the date that this request is processed.

Please be advised that in order for DEP to process your request, NAICS code 111421 (nursery/ tree production), 111422 (floriculture production), 111998 (miscellaneous farming - including greenhouse, nursery & floriculture products) will be used to identify complaints in this sector.

We have an existing backlog of FOIA requests in queue received prior to yours, so there is an expected delay.  Additionally, all FOIAs are reviewed by the Office of the Solicitor prior to release, which may protract processing time.  Please keep these considerations in mind as you await your response.
Best regards,




April Streets
Government Information Specialist
Occupational Safety and Health Administration
Directorate of Enforcement Programs (DEP)
streets.april@dol.gov

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Swatting
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am seeking the following information that is classified as directory information under FERPA:

1. Enrollment status of Alan Winston Filion, born on 10/30/2006 (e.g., whether the student is currently enrolled, was enrolled in the past, or is no longer enrolled).
2. Major field of study of  Alan Winston Filion, born on 10/30/2006.
3. Dates of attendance  of Alan Winston Filion, born on 10/30/2006.
4. Degrees and awards received of Alan Winston Filion, born on 10/30/2006.

I am also looking for any releasable emails, communications, or memos from AVC staff containing the words "Alan Winston Filion", "Alan Filion", or "Torswats".

I understand that certain details may be protected under FERPA and are not subject to disclosure without the student's consent. If any part of my request is denied, please provide the specific exemption you believe justifies the refusal to release the information and inform me of the appeal procedures available under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dhruv Mehrotra

title: South Carolina ORR Noncitizen Voting 07.12.24 (Office of the Governor - South Carolina)

communications.subject: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: South Carolina ORR Noncitizen Voting 07.12.24 (Office of the Governor - South Carolina)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documented requests all electronic records containing the following keywords and email domains: 

Keywords and phrases: 
“Non citizen voting”
“Only Citizens vote”
“Illegals voting”
“Election Integrity Network” 
“EIN” 
“Jenny Beth Martin”  
“Kerri Toloczko”
“Lindsey Zea”
“Melody Clarke”
“Cleta Mitchell” 
“Kyle Brosnan” 
“Rosemary Jenks” 
“Immigration Accountability Project”
“America First Legal” 
“America First Policy Institute” 
“Election Transparency Initiative” 
“Ken Blackwell” 
“Hogan Gidley” 
“Ken Cuccinneli” 
“Oversight Project” 
“Heritage Foundation” 
“J. Christian Adams”
“Andy Roth”
“Evan Newman”
“Eagle AI”
“Eagle Eye”


Email domains: 
“@virginiainstitute.org”
“@unite4freedom.com” 
“@electionintegrity.network”
“@teapartypatriots.org” 
“@iaproject.org”
“@AFL.org” 
“@americafirstpolicy.com” 

The scope of this request includes the following legislators and all staff that report directly to the legislators: 

Secretary of State Mark Hammond
Governor Henry McMaster

The search for records should include sent and received emails and any other electronic records including, but not limited to, scheduling and calendar records, text messages, and messages on messaging platforms, such as Slack, GChat or Google Hangouts, iMessage, WhatsApp, Signal, Telegram, Skype, Twitter direct messages, Facebook Messenger, or Parler. The search for email records should also include any email accounts used to conduct official business, including personal email addresses such as a "gmail" or "yahoo" account.

Please include any attachments to those records and other materials enclosed with those records at the time they were transmitted. For instance, for an email that is responsive to our request, please include all prior messages sent or received in that email chain, as well as any attachments to the email.

The search for records may be limited to records created, sent or received between January 1st, 2024 through to the date of your final response.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, please notify me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request be filled electronically by email attachment if available, or CD-ROM if not.

Please confirm receipt of this request. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response.
Sincerely,
Victoria Cadostin 
857-504-4870

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Victoria Cadostin

communications.subject: RE: South Carolina Public Records Law Request: South Carolina ORR Noncitizen Voting 07.12.24 (Office of the Governor - South Carolina)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Unita Zelma Blackwell
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to or mentioning Unita Zelma Blackwell (March 18, 1933 – May 13, 2019).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma Best

    Emma Best
    
    Attachments:
    
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/TheEmmaBest/70973/Unita20Blackwell2C20862C20Dies3B20Rights20Crusader20and20Winner20of20Historic20Elec.pdf
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/TheEmmaBest/70973/Unita20Blackwell201933-201920-20Find20A20Grave20Memorial.pdf
    
    https://cdn.muckrock.com/outbound_composer_attachments/TheEmmaBest/70973/Fee20category20and20search20parameters.pdf
    Upload documents directly:
    https://https://www.muckrock.comhttps://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Ffederal-bureau-of-investigation-10%252Funita-zelma-blackwell-74255%252F%253Femail%253Dfoipaquestions%252540ic.fbi.gov&url_auth_token=AAAj2ProGzquHYFeb-SMkiAXsEc%3A1hWEDl%3A_qnsnqN5GjcId7UIeltvEuIMsUs

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: HK - MA/FNB
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show: Any correspondence, including emails, to and from Heather Keil with the words 'mutual aid' or references to Food Not Bombs,  from March 20, 2024 to the date this request is processed. Please include emails where Heather is cc'ed or bcc'ed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexandra Gelzin

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: PRA: Autopsy and coroner’s reports
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act (Government Code Section 6250 et seq.) ("CPRA”), and all other applicable laws, please disclose the following records.

Any and all autopsy, death investigation, and coroner’s reports relating to the deaths of the following individuals:

-2019-00919, ARTURO VENZOR MENDOZA, 04-16-1971, 02-02-2019
-2019-01217, OSCAR JAVIER ROJAS, 04-15-1984, 02-12-2019
-can't locate case #, WILFREDO	HERNANDEZ, 12-06-1971, 02-14-2019
-2019-04451, ROBERT BUSTAMANTE, 12-28-1975, 06-11-2019
-2019-01656, IDALIA DENIZ,  06-24-1989, 02-26-2019
-2019-03197, MARTIN JR DELTORO, 03-29-1982, 04-25-2019
-2019-07103, DANIEL ANDREW WELSH, 11-07-1985, 09-19-2019
-2019-07211, LUIS FRANCISCO ROJAS,	01-25-1971, 09-24-2019
-2019-07104, GERARDO JR	SAMANIEGO, 04-05-1993, 09-19-2019
-2019-02897, JACOBO JUAREZ	CEDILLO, 08-18-1968, 04-13-2019
-2019-05028, JOSEPH	R	CARRETERO, 10-13-1995, 07-05-2019
-can't locate case #, LUIS ANGEL RAMIREZ,	12-01-1981, 02-21-2020
-2020-02775, EDWARD BRONSTEIN, 09-14-1981, 03-31-2020
-2020-01355, SABINO PIASOLA, 02-04-1982, 02-13-2020
-2020-01701, STARR BIVENS, 06-20-1983, 02-24-2020
-2020-02301, ERIC BRICENO, 10-16-1980, 03-16-2020
-2020-04042, RUEBEN ESCARREGA, 11-04-1988, 05-08-2020
-2020-04262, ANTHONY YSAAC, 11-02-1992, 05-14-2020
-can't locate case #, PAUL NORMAN JEFFERIES, 01-19-1983, 07-28-2020
-2020-07408, DANIEL RIVERA, 01-13-1983, 08-14-2020
-2020-09756, SEAN	PATRICK MURPHY, 12-27-1976, 10-18-2020
-2020-09834, AMBER NOELLE GARCIA, 08-15-1995,	10-21-2020
-2020-10541, BRAYDEN	SKYLER MADDEN, 11-26-1999, 11-11-2020
-2021-01388, ARTURO SUAZO, 11-05-1965, 01-13-2021
-2021-01166, JESUS NICKOLAS	MALDONADO GALLO, 12-26-2003, 01-14-2021
-2021-04015, RAMIRO VILLEGAS, 08-24-1962, 03-13-2021
-2021-04301, RICHARD	HAYES, 01-07-1977, 03-21-2021
-2021-04439, RAUL	JR	MUNOZ, 01-02-1959, 03-26-2021
-2021-09468, RONALD	STEVEN CARTER, 11-09-1986, 08-18-2021
-2021-09720, ANTHONY ANGEL	GOMEZ, 12-25-1996, 08-25-2021
-2021-06245, TRAMOI	SPRINGTATE,04-20-1982, 05-18-2021
-2021-06685, DESHAWN JOHNSON, 08-19-1991, 06-02-2021
-2022-02646, TRISTEN	TIMOTHY LEE	KING,	03-30-2005,  03-04-2022
-2022-06044, WAYNE BOBBY DYE, 06-08-1976, 06-08-2022
-2022-06027, EDWIN ANDRADE, 04-27-1981, 06-08-2022
-2022-07881, GREGORIO, FIGUEROA, 11-18-1985, 07-29-2022
-2023-00126, KEENAN ANDERSON, 05-16-1991,	01-03-2023
-2023-02951, ALEXANDER	EDUARDO	RUIZ,	02-10-1989, 03-16-2023
-2023-03378, JOHN DAVID JR FIGUEROA, 08-20-1990,03-28-2023

The list can also be viewed in this spreadsheet: https://docs.google.com/spreadsheets/d/1FrT_pCJZ7W8wwW_8UPtpbMDQL7i1ueOSxUht-6K6LQc/edit?usp=sharing

If records pursuant to this request are possessed in machine-readable format such as an .xls, .csv spreadsheet file, please provide the record in this format. Please disclose these records in the format in which they are kept, e.g., .ppt, .pptx, .doc, or .docx.

The fundamental rule of the CPRA is a presumption of public access. “In other words, [A]ll public records are subject to disclosure unless the Legislature has expressly provided to the contrary.” Williams v. Superior Court, 5 Cal. 4th 337 (1993). This presumption finds further support in the California Constitution, as amended by Proposition 59 in 2004. “A statute, court rule, or other authority, including those in effect on the effective date of this subdivision, shall be broadly construed if it furthers the people's right of access, and narrowly construed if it limits the right of access.” Cal. Const. Art. 1 § 3(b)(2).

Please provide a determination on this request within 10 days of your receipt of it. If you determine that any or all of the information qualifies for an exemption from disclosure, please note whether, as is normally the case, the exemption is discretionary, and if so whether it is necessary in this case to exercise your discretion to withhold the information. If you determine that some but not all of the information is exempt from disclosure and that you intend to withhold it, please redact it for the time being and make the rest available as requested. In any event, please provide a signed notification citing the legal authorities on which you rely if you determine that any or all of the information is exempt and will not be disclosed.

Please apply a fee waiver to this request. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please provide notification of any duplication costs exceeding $50 before you duplicate the records. If the request for a fee waiver is denied, please further provide an index of all other requests since 2018 for which a fee waiver was denied, and the reason therefore.

Please respond to this request and disclose the records electronically by email to this MuckRock email address. Please let us know if you have any questions or if we can help ensure this request is the least burdensome possible for your agency while providing a correct and full disclosure in the public interest.

If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to reach out to me via email at sam.levin@theguardian.com or 646-935-9115. 

Thanks so much,

Best,
Sam Levin

communications.subject: RE: New York Freedom of Information Law Request #DOCCS-23-07-235
communications.communication:
Hello,

This is an appeal of the determination on FOIL request DOCCS-23-07-235. The request yielded 12 pages, which consisted of a DOCCS Directive  8700, titled "Community Preparation Case – Assignment and Release Investigation Process."

DOCCS cited three FOIL statute exemptions in redacting the document. Among them is Public Officers Law §87(2)(g): "inter/intra agency materials which are not final agency policy or decisions, statistical or factual tabulations, external audits, or instructions to staff that affect the public."

As a DOCCS directive, the document is by definition a final agency policy. Thus POL §87(2)(g) does not apply. Thus I request that DOCCS:

(a) itemize the redactions, explaining which FOIL statute exemption applies to each, and
(b) unredact all portions of the document which cite POL §87(2)(g) as the justification.

Please let me know if you have any questions. My phone number is (419) 309-6331.

Sicnerely,
Chris Gelardi

communications.subject: Minnesota Government Data Practices Act Request: Minneapolis Police Department, Minneapolis, MN Request
communications.communication:
To Whom it may concern,
Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:
Any and all records from the past year regarding your nuisance property ordinance that will be referred to as ordinance in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as Conduct on licensed premises as described in 244.2020. of the city code.
Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Ordinance including but not limited to:
• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance
The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.
In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.
Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request.
Sincerely,
Jenny Wadhwa

 Public Comments: 
2024-08-01 13:37:18 CDT - Liz Dvorak Public Comments 
Hello, 
Data responsive to your request have been released through the OpenCity portal. It can take up to 15 minutes for the data to appear. Please log in to your OpenCity account, click on My Requests and then select this reference number to view the available data. 
Data was redacted and/or withheld per Minnesota Statutes, Chapter 13: Government Data Practices–Section 13.44 and 18 USC 2721. Nuisance property complaints are handled by the Minneapolis Regulatory Services department and are not tied to police nuisance calls. The Minneapolis Police Department does not maintain data in way to respond to this request. 
The data in the spreadsheet is contains nuisance property calls from Minneapolis from 4/10/24 to 4/10/23 as identified by Regulatory Services. 
Additional information about vacant and condemned properties can be found here: https://www.minneapolismn.gov/government/government-data/datasource/vacant-condemned-property-dashboard/ (https://www.minneapolismn.gov/government/government-data/datasource/vacant-condemned-property-dashboard/) 
Your request will be closed at this time. 
Thank you, 
Elizabeth Dvorak l  Enterprise Information Management Analyst  l  City of Minneapolis – City Clerk’s Office l elizabeth.dvorak@minneapolismn.gov (mailto:elizabeth.dvorak@minneapolismn.gov)

title: Fulton County Jail Emergency Evacuation Plan

communications.subject: Georgia Open Records Act Request: Fulton County Jail Emergency Evacuation Plan
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Georgia Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting documents surrounding the Fulton County Jail's emergency evacuation plan. My request applies to records maintained by or within the possession, custody or control
of Fulton County, including, but not limited to, the Fulton County Sheriff's Office and the Atlanta Police Department as well as any authorized sub-entity, agent, vendor or contractor. All guides, manuals, standard operating procedures (SOPs) and other written policies, procedures or directives related to emergency evacuations of the people incarcerated in the jail in the event of fire, flooding, disease, or any other disaster, including all interim, draft or superseded versions, are included in this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Hannah Riley

communications.communication:
Dear Sir:  This will acknowledge receipt of letters dated December 11, 2023 and December 26, 2023 pertaining to a Public Records Request to the City of Columbia, MS Police Department.  The City of Columbia has a Public Records Request Policy.  Please contact Maria Temples, City Clerk, 601-736-8201, or email, mtemples@cityofcolumbiams.com<mailto:mtemples@cityofcolumbiams.com> to request a Public Records Request Form.  Once you have completed the form and returned it to Ms. Temples, it will be reviewed for the time estimate and cost estimate (to be paid prior to production) to determine what documents, if any, are subject to production under the laws of the State of Mississippi.

Best regards, Lawrence

Lawrence E. Hahn
McNeese & Hahn, PLLC
338 Church Street
P. O. Drawer 948
Columbia, MS  39429
Telephone:  601-731-5020
Fax:  601-731-5030
E-Mail:  lhahn@mcneesehahn.com<mailto:lhahn@mcneesehahn.com>

NOTICE:  This electronic mail transmission (including any referenced or attached materials) may be PRIVILEGED, WORK PRODUCT, PROPRIETARY and/or CONFIDENTIAL.  It is not intended for transmission to, or receipt by, any unauthorized persons.  If you have received this electronic mail transmission in error, you are PROHIBITED from disclosing, disseminating, reproducing, using or relying on it and its contents, and you are to immediately delete it from your system without copying it, and notify the sender by reply e-mail of the erroneous transmission.

communications.subject: Arizona Public Records Law Request: Agency Roster
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arizona Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Email Metadata (Nelson)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by CM  Sara Nelson's office between the dates of February 1, 2024 - April 1, 2024:
- Sender
- Recipient (To, CC, BCC)
- Date and time sent
- Subject

As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: Legislative Branch :: C177571-040724
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Welcome to the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center (PRRC). Your request was received on April 07, 2024 and is appended below. 
 
The reference number for this request is C177571-040724. You will see this number in the title of any communications about this request. 
 
You will hear from a Public Disclosure Officer within five business days regarding the status of your request. 
 
Please visit the City of Seattle Public Records Request Center where you can manage your profile and access your request. Your login ID is: 161723-98033572@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If a Public Disclosure Officer submitted your public disclosure request into the PRRC on your behalf, please login and complete your new user account by following these steps: 
 
  * Access the Public Records Request Center 
  * Select 'Forgot my Password' 
  * Enter your 'Login ID' (email address) 
  * A temporary password will be sent to you via email 
  * Login with the temporary password 
You may now visit the PRRC 'My Records Request Center' anytime!

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by CM Sara Nelson's office between the dates of February 1, 2024 - April 1, 2024:

Sincerely,

Rose Terse

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C177571-040724
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C177571-040724 received on April 07, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C177571-1 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C177571-040724. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C177571-1. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Legislative Branch :: C177571-040724
communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

Dear Rose Terse, 
Records are now available in response to your request C177571-040724 regarding the following: To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

The following metadata for emails sent by all accounts operated by CM Sara Nelson's office between the dates of February 1, 2024 - April 1, 2024: 
- Sender 
- Recipient (To, CC, BCC) 
- Date and time sent 
- Subject 

As this is a request for metadata, please do not include the email body in the returned records. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. 

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires. 

Sincerely, 

Rose Terse 

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fcity-council-219%252Femail-metadata-nelson-161723%252F%253Femail%253Dmuckrockseattle%252540mycusthelp.net&url_auth_token=AAAbJQToMIQHI1KMRcuzZrve4-c%3A1rtf9k%3Ac6CkFucdi_qpF049qZ29RdlG9ec6wUN_sjToowUzbcU 
The records being made available to you at this time include a spreadsheet with the metadata you specified from Sara Nelson's emails. We need to do the same for her office staff and expect to have those to you on or near July 19, 2024. 
To download your records, please: 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Select this request: C177571-040724. 
  * Select the 'View Files' button. 
  * You can download records individually or all at the same time by clicking 'Download All'. 
  *  Please save your records as you may only download them from the system three times. If you do not download your records within 30 days of request closure, the link to your records will expire. 
If you believe you have received privileged or confidential records in error, please notify the City of Seattle immediately, through the Public Records Request Center or by email. Privileged or confidential records provided or received in error should not be reviewed, used, disseminated, distributed, or copied, and should be destroyed immediately. Thank you in advance for your cooperation. 
We have redacted records that are exempt from disclosure under the Public Records Act. Please see the attached exemption log. 
Sincerely, 
Matthew C. Jaeger 
(206) 684-8159 
Legislative Department

communications.subject: City of Seattle Public Records Request Center - Invoice Ready :: C177571-040724
communications.communication:
Dear Rose Terse, 
 
Records in response to your public disclosure request C177571-040724 received on April 07, 2024 are now available. The cost for the records is as follows: 
 
Invoice Number: INV24-C177571-2 
Total: $1.25 
 
To pay online, please follow these steps: 
 Please note that you will need to disable any pop-up blockers to make a payment using the system. 
 
  * Navigate to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * Select 'My Records Request Center'. 
  * Select 'View My Requests'. You may be asked to login. 
  * Find this request: C177571-040724. 
  * Select the 'View Invoices' button. 
 
  * Opens a pop-up window showing your invoice: INV24-C177571-2. 
  * Click on the invoice and then the 'Pay Now' button. 
  * Continue processing your payment. 
  * Select 'Done'. 
  * Once the payment process is done, you are returned to the Public Records Request Center. 
  * After your payment is successful you will receive an email from our payments center. 
Once your payment has been approved, we will send you an email with instructions on how to download your records. Note that City staff must manually upload records. Records will be available one to two business days after payment. 
 
Please let your public disclosure officer (PDO) know if you are unable to pay online; your PDO will work with you on alternative ways to make your payment. 
 
You have 30 days from today's date to pay for your records. If the City does not receive your payment within this time period, your request will be considered abandoned, and you will need to submit a new request. 
 Please add seattle@mycusthelp.net to your E-mail contacts/address book to ensure delivery of the record center E-mails to your Inbox. (mailto:seattle@mycusthelp.net) 
This is an auto-generated email and has originated from an unmonitored email account. Please DO NOT REPLY.

communications.subject: Pennsylvania Right to Know Act Request: Policy documents
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any policy manual, employee procedure manual, or folder of collected policies which guide police operations. This may be one document with many policies, or all policies collected.

The original format of the documents is acceptable (PDF, .doc, .txt, etc).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Josh Chamberlain
